name: Ensure that the endpoint protection for all Virtual Machines is installed
body:
Install endpoint protection for all virtual machines.

**Rationale**

Installing endpoint protection systems (like Antimalware for Azure) provides for real-time protection capability that helps identify and remove viruses, spyware, and other malicious software, with configurable alerts when known malicious or unwanted software attempts to install itself or run on Azure systems.

**Impact**

Endpoint protection will incur an additional cost to you.
remediationDescription:
Follow Microsoft Azure documentation to install endpoint protection from the security center. Alternatively, you can employ your own endpoint protection tool for your OS.

**References**

1. [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security-center/security-center-install-endpoint-protection](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security-center/security-center-install-endpoint-protection)
2. [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/azure-security-antimalware](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/azure-security-antimalware)
3. [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cli/azure/vm/extension?view=azure-cli-latest#az_vm_extension_list](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cli/azure/vm/extension?view=azure-cli-latest#az_vm_extension_list)
4. [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-endpoint-security#es-1-use-endpoint-detection-and-response-edr](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/benchmarks/security-controls-v2-endpoint-security#es-1-use-endpoint-detection-and-response-edr)
